name: Philodendron Black Cardinal
climate: Philodendron Black Cardinal thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with high humidity.
This plant prefers warm temperatures and does not tolerate frost or cold drafts well.
Humidity levels should ideally be above 50% to ensure optimal growth of the Philodendron Black Cardinal.
It can be grown indoors in temperate climates, replicating warm, humid conditions.
sunlight: Philodendron Black Cardinal prefers bright, indirect sunlight to maintain its rich foliage color.
Direct sunlight can scorch the leaves, so avoid placing it in harsh, direct rays.
It can adapt to lower light conditions, but growth might slow, and colors may fade.
East-facing windows, or filtered light from sheer curtains, suit it best indoors.
watering: Allow the top inch of soil to dry out between waterings to prevent root rot.
Water thoroughly, but ensure that excess water drains away completely from the pot.
Overwatering can lead to yellowing leaves; under-watering results in visible wilting.
Humidity trays or misting can help supplement moisture without overwatering.
soil: Well-draining soil mix rich in organic matter is ideal for Philodendron Black Cardinal.
A mix of peat, pine bark, and perlite is recommended for optimal aeration and drainage.
Avoid heavy soils that retain excessive moisture, as they can lead to root rot.
Soil should be slightly acidic to neutral, with a pH around 5.5 to 7.0 for best results.
toxic: Philodendron Black Cardinal is toxic if ingested by pets and humans, causing irritation.
extra_care_tip: Regularly clean the leaves with a damp cloth to remove dust and maintain their shine.
